rows.game: Runaway, The Dream of The Turtle

rows.notes:
You need to install NorthernUI in order to use a controller. It does not naitivly support controller input.
It runs perfectly in the beginning, but once I got outside, I couldn't move without wiggling the stick. I had to look up why it was happening and its because of the performance settings. If you have it on Performance in the container settings, you get stuck as well as npcs; intermediate you can move but frames drop below 30fps.

Go to Settings in the Winlator menu and clone the Performance settings, then disable Box64_Dynarec_CallRet. Performance is now amazing and no issues. 
Copy performance setting, edit it and disable Box64_Dynarec_CallRet. Then increase Box64_Dynarec_Forward to 1024 for better performance.

If the game doesn't run for you, try these steps in this order:
1. In the Winlator settings for your game's shortcut, open the Advanced tab and scroll down to "Exec Arguments." Put in "/failsafe" without the quotes. If the game boots up, remember to remove this arg before next launch.
2. In your container's start menu look for a DirectX 2010 installer (in Frost it's in Start > Install > Install DX June 2010)
3. Install the Visual C++ Redistributable 2010 (some versions of Winlator have an installer in the start menu, otherwise download from Microsoft.)

Hopefully by this point the game is running for you.

'- Winlator is 11.0 (Beta) at the time I post, 09 Oct 2025, downloaded from https://github.com/brunodev85/winlator/releases
- Skyrim is the very basic game, not Special Edition and not Anniversary, as of what I know they are 64-bit, mine is the very first basic version, 32-bit, they also call it LE (Legendary Edition)
- Audio driver - ALSA (I didn't have to install anything additional to make it work, because people have issue with the same on GameHub)
- Box64 preset is "Performance" (not I start the game from the "Shortbut" section of Winlator, not from the container itself)

They key for this to work is:

- Turnip - Max Device Memory > 2GB
- DXVK - Max Device Memory > 2GB

All settings to low, resolution is 960x544 and the resolution is configured in the container in My Documents\My Games\SkyrimPrefs.ini (Google it)

I locked "Frame Rate" to 30, but I think it can work with 60.

I am willing to help, you can contact me on my YT channel called "Gamsterr" , its dead channel, I don't post anymore, so please don't count this as me promoting myself... I am offering free help, as I suffered alot to make this work and I see other people posting configs in this page, but theirs are very incomplete.

Thanks to RyanRetro, I found this by his page and his work and YouTube content helped me a lot to set my RP5
Mid settings, 30 fps framecap for stability
Mid settings, 30 fps framecap for stability

After tinkering with every Switch emulator, and Winlator, I have found I way to have Skyrim running smoothly on Winlator (10.1 Hotfix).  Once you are in the Helgen Keep, you can use these settings:
Screen Size:  1280x720
Graphics Driver: Turnip (25.1.0, 4096MB, Enable Direct rendering)
DX Wrapper: DXVK (2.4.1, Frame Rate 30, Max Device Memory 0, Custom Device None)
Audio: PulseAudio (Low Latency, Avg Latency 40ms).  I had some minor audio issues with ASLA and this resolved them.
Win Components: Direct3D - Native,  DirectSound - Native, DirectMusic - Wine (I had minor audio issues with Native), DirectShow - Wine, DirectPlay - Wine, XAudio- Native, Visual C++ 2005 - Wine, Visual C++ 2010 - Native, Windows Media Decoder - Native.
Environmental Variables - Zink_descriptors - Lazy, zink debug - compact, mesa shader cache disable - off, mesa shader cache max size - 512mb, mesa glthread - on, winesync - on, tu_debug - sysmem (I had performance issues with the default option).
Advance: Box 64 - Stability (Many swear by Performance, but I found less issues with Stability), Startup selection - Aggressive, Windows Version - Windows 7, Processor Affinity - everything.

*HOWEVER*

These settings will encounter a crash sometime during the intro (until you're in the Helgen Keep, at least).  So for just the intro, change the DX Wrapper to WineD3D: GTX 1080 Ti, Backbuffer, 4096 MB, disable both CSMT and Shader Math.  It's going to run at like 6 fps, but it's shouldn't crash and should get you through to Helgen Keep.  Then change it back to the standard settings above and the game runs buttery smooth, even on this older chipset.

With a 30 fps cap and low quality settings, I would consider the performance great if not for the intro.  Occasional dips of 25 fps when in combat on the world map, and the workaround on the intro, keep this from being perfect, but it's extremely playable.
Audio Driver>PulseAudio | BOX64_DYNAREC_SAFEFLAGS>2 | BOX64_DYNAREC_FASTROUND 1 | All other settings default. Easily maintains 60fps at 1024x768

environment variable "BOX64_DYNAREC_STRONGMEM" and setting it's value to "1". Use "Performance" mode first for BOX64 settings. If the game crashes, change it from performance to "Intermediate." If it still crashes, try "Compatibility" and then lastly "Stability" if nothing else worked.

Turnip Version 25.1.0, WineD3D Version 10.10, Box64 Preset Stability, Startup Selection Normal, Windows 7. Long bootup time (be patient). Set the Ingame Framelimit to 30FPS to reduce stuttering. Expect some Inputlag with the Controller (better play with Mouse). Once it runs you can expect a decent gamesession.
